content: i agree with @Jp82 .... only with BIG MINOR Test case you might notice the suffix after the type of change changes

Hi @nlarche !

I did your Clash a few minutes ago, it's a good idea,
but in reverse mode ... the 3 examples in the Goal part are not available ...
-> your final Validators are too far from Test cases !
+ without the goal explanations, it's not possible to be sure what is really intended ...
=> Please : change or add test cases closer than your validators !
for example : 0.0.0 + MAJOR = 1.0.0
is too different than 9.8.7 + MAJOR = 10.0.0

=> Can you simply add your 3 examples in separated new test cases ?
Merci ;-) ...

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clear and intuitive description. A bit simple but sufficient for a clash of code.

Great idea, however it really is simple to solve.
It would improve the game if you made several changes possibles. So the second input, instead of being a simple change, would be a succession of changes.
For example:
"MAJOR PATCH MINOR MAJOR PATCH MINOR"
And it would be more subtle because you would have to reset the patch's number at each new minor version and reset the minor's number at each new major version.
Good idea anyway!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Its simple to solve

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting problem statement around a common software paradigm. Could be further augmented to automate semantic version bumps depending on release tag keywords in the real world.

Goal section
* Typo: "Exemple" should be spelled as "Example".

Input and Output sections
* Please remove the examples in these two sections.
* "An string" should be changed as "A string".
* Please follow the example in the contribution guidelines for the presentation of these two sections.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines
For example, line numbers should be included and variable types should be stated.

Constraints section
* Please format the variables.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.

Hi. ^^

For minor and major updates, it doesn't make sense you don't change suffixes to 0. Imo, "9.8.7 MAJOR" should result to "10.0.0", not "10.8.7".
Oh my bad, yes you're right ! I'll fix this
